title: Motion in one dimension - car dropping coins

content.prompt: As a toy car moves along a level track, coins are placed beside the carâ€™s position on the track every second. The locations of the coins are shown in the diagram. Which of the following claims about the acceleration of the car is correct?

choices.label: The acceleration is not constant because the spacings between successive coins increase and then decrease.
The acceleration is not constant because the spacings between the coins are not all the same.
The acceleration is zero because the spacing between the last two coins is the same as the spacing between the first two coins.
The acceleration is zero because only the position is changing, while acceleration is the change in the velocity.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
